isis.stitle: FRONT NON-DRIVE STEERING AXLE: ROCKWELL - INSPECTION - CHECKING THE VERTICAL END PLAY OF THE STEERING KNUCKLE

svcproc.title: CHECKING THE VERTICAL END PLAY OF THE STEERING KNUCKLE

step1.para: Put blocks in front and behind the rear wheels to prevent the vehicle from moving.

warning.para: Do not work under a vehicle only supported by jack stands. Jack stands can slip or fall over and cause serious personal injury.

step1.para: Use a jack to raise the vehicle until the front wheels are off the ground. Support the front axle with safety stands.
Install a dial indicator so that the base is on the I-beam and the tip is on the top knuckle cap ( Figure 4).

figure.caption: Figure 4. Steering Knuckle with Dial Indicator

step1.para: Put a pry bar between the boss for the tie rod arm and the I-beam. Push the knuckle to the bottom of vertical travel ( Figure 5).
Set the dial indicator on zero (0).
Use the pry bar to push the knuckle upward. Record the reading on the dial indicator.

svcproc.para: The. reading must be 0.001 to 0.025 inch (0.025 to 0.635mm) for new or rebuilt axles and 0.001 to 0.065 inch (0.025 to 1.650mm) for axles in service ( Figure 5).
If the reading is zero (0), remove the knuckle and remove shims from the shim pack. Refer to DISASSEMBLE, CLEANAND ASSEMBLE.
If the reading is more than the maximum specification, remove the knuckle and add shims to the shim pack. Refer to ASSEMBLE, KNUCKLE .
